name: opensea_bulk_search
description: Search multiple NFT queries on OpenSea in parallel using concurrent browser tabs. Use this instead of calling opensea_search multiple times - it is faster and more efficient. Pass all queries as a single comma-separated string. Example: 'bored ape,azuki,doodles'.

detailSteps.code: const results = []; const items = document.querySelectorAll('a[data-id="Item"], a[href*="/collection/"], [class*="AssetCard"], [class*="collection-card"]'); const seen = new Set(); for (let i = 0; i < items.length && results.length < 5; i++) { const el = items[i]; const link = el.href || el.querySelector('a')?.href || ''; if (!link || seen.has(link)) continue; seen.add(link); const nameEl = el.querySelector('[data-testid="ItemCardFooter-name"], [class*="name"], h3, span'); const priceEl = el.querySelector('[data-testid="ItemCardPrice"], [class*="price"], [class*="floor"]'); const imgEl = el.querySelector('img'); const name = nameEl?.textContent?.trim() || ''; if (!name) continue; results.push({ name: name, url: link, floor_price: priceEl?.textContent?.trim() || '', image: imgEl?.src || '' }); } const params = new URLSearchParams(window.location.search); return { query: params.get('query') || '', result_count: results.length, results: results }
detailSteps.name: search_results
detailSteps.label: Extract results
